nodes.text: Most of you did very well on the last quiz.
Oddly enough, Herr Sosi, you did worse than your normal excellence.
I'm still shaken by poor Joel's tragic demise, Master. Forgive me - I'll do better next time.
Do not let the loss of your former roommate's excellent study habits and test-taking abilities affect your grade so negatively.
I'm sorry, sir. I was distracted by recent events.
If poor results could be excused by recent events, I should think that it would be Herr Kyro making that excuse rather than you. However, Herr Kyro did very well despite his ordeal.
Herr Kent, Herr Kyro, and Herr O'Conner had perfect scores. I shall be watching you more carefully next time to determine how you all are colluding.
Herr Kent and Herr O'Conner had perfect scores on the test. In Herr O'Conner's case, there must be some validity to 'sleep learning' since he seems to doze off through so many of my lectures...
Herr Kent and Herr Kyro had perfect scores. The rest of you did as well as could be expected on your part.
You all did well upon the quiz, but only Herr Kent scored correctly on every question.
Herr Kent and Herr Kyro had perfect scores. Most of you did as well as could be expected on your part.
Herr Kent correctly answered every question. In general, you all did well on the test.
However, Herr O'Conner, I cannot say the same for you. This late in the semester, I expect improvement rather than a demonstration of laziness and sloppy study habits.
Like my esteemed colleague, Caesari, I, too, have been caught up in recent events at the expense of my study habits. However, that time was spent putting the Rogue lesson theory into practice.
Your lessons probably saved my life. Thank you, Master.
I was up too late the night before the test and I was too exhausted to think. You see, It's like this, sir...

I heard a noise in the middle of the night coming from the hallway, so I got out of bed to see what was going on. There I saw a ghostly bard wailing out for Bloody Benjamin to sell him some chimes. I spent the night convincing the ghost that it was no use...
Everyone knows, Red Ben sells no bells.
Hey, at least you can tell that I don't cheat on the tests!
I prefer to tell that you study your lessons rather than judge your lack of cheating skills.
Are there any other questions or comments about the test?

options.text: Ask About the Advanced Tool Use Question

nodes.text: Why wasn't the answer about Advanced Tool Use 'All of the Above', since the answers all applied?
First of all, the question asked for the 'best' answer. Secondly, I have yet to "fibrore to defringe" the latch mechanism of any lock.
For question two about Wraiths, it seems to me that all the answers applied...

All of the answers for the Wraith question were reasonable suggestions for dealing with Wraiths, but only one answer was the 'best' one - Don't. The best thing to do with Wraiths is to avoid them all together.

options.text: Ask About the Sol Rune Question

nodes.text: What was the answer to the Sol Rune question?
A Sol Rune is used to damage disembodied spirits rather than to light your path or allow you to adventure.

options.text: Ask About the Raven Statue Question

nodes.text: So why wasn't the answer to the question about the Raven Statue 'All of the Above?'

For one thing, the question was phrased "The Raven Statue is not..." The only statement that was untrue about the statue was "a mythical Macguffin that magically makes more thieves." There is no inherent magic to the statue. It is merely a symbol.
If Caesari's grief over the loss of Kyro is so great that he can't pass a test, doe that mean that he's incon-joel-able?
So as far as test scores go - Thomas and Joel are the quiz whizzes. Since Sosi messed up his test - he's clearly de-test-able.
Herr O'Conner, you continue to test my patience...
It seems like you go out of your way to make these quizzes tricky and difficult. If you really want to know whether we learned anything or not, why not just ask a straight question?
That statement assumes that I have the slightest interest in what you already know - which I do not. I prefer to make you practice your critical thinking skills.
Tomorrow's lesson will be on the concept of the "Trickster" and the role of the Rogue in society.
Dismissed.
